alert.note: Alert for Central and Southeast Phillips; Garfield; Petroleum (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 10:23PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Phillips, northeastern Petroleum and southwestern Garfield Counties through 1130 PM MDT... At 1023 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Crooked Creek Rec Area, or 33 miles northeast of Winnett, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fourchette, Devils Creek Rec Area, Crooked Creek Rec Area, U L Bend Rec Area, Brusett and Steve Fork. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Central and Southeast Phillips; Garfield; Petroleum
